name: biomni-query-interpro
title: Biomni: Query Interpro
description: Query InterPro for protein family classifications, functional domains, and sequence features integrated from multiple databases.
content:
Overview

Searches InterPro, an integrated resource that classifies proteins into families and predicts functional domains and important sites. InterPro combines predictions from multiple member databases (Pfam, SMART, ProSite, etc.) to provide comprehensive protein functional annotation.

Input Parameters

  • prompt (string, optional): Natural language query about protein domains, families, or motifs
  • endpoint (string, optional): Specific InterPro API endpoint
  • max_results (integer, optional): Maximum number of results to return (default: 3)

Biological Use Case

Essential for protein function prediction, domain architecture analysis, and evolutionary studies. Researchers use InterPro to identify functional domains in novel proteins, predict protein function from sequence, understand domain evolution, classify protein families, and identify active sites or binding regions for structural and biochemical studies.

Output

Returns a parameters (interpro_results.json) containing domain/family information including InterPro accessions, domain names and descriptions, member database signatures, GO term associations, taxonomic distribution, protein counts, structural information, and cross-references to related databases.

Category

database
